result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keyshawna Shaleaha M Bonds

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Catherine Jane Terry in court for Keyshawna Shaleaha M Bonds.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty authorization to appear filed. Defendant unable to find a ride to court today.  Court authorizes and stays warrant, Defendant must appear in person for the adjourned hearing. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Motion for Discovery and Inspection & Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Keyshawna Shaleaha M Bonds in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court admonishes def re making court appearances.  Def was attempting to retain counsel, but has been unable to do so.  Def req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Terry.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $300 per month commencing 10-15-22. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Def called to indicate she has not hired counsel and requested she be allowed to appear by Zoom for hearing on 9-28-22 as she does not live in Wash Co.; it was explained that Court previously said she needed to appear in person and that if she did not appear a warrant could issue.
Def left message re non-appearance for today's hearing; she was informed next hearing is set 9-28-22 at 9:45am and that she needed to appear in person (address verified).

Defendant Keyshawna Shaleaha M Bonds not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def called COC to say she would not be at today's hearing as she could not reach her attorney (no retainer on file).
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
No contact with Washington County Walmart stores. No contact with C.S. or S.W.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keyshawna Shaleaha M Bonds in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Keyshawna Shaleaha M Bonds. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def plans to retain private counsel.  Court sets $500 signature bond. Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
